column4: i'm having networking issues.  i can't ping anything from one computer, except for its own ip
i can't ping the other computer, not can i ping it from other computers
but ifconfig on that computer shows an ip
not sure what to do now.  how do i troubleshoot this from here?
are you pinging using hostnames, or ip?
ip
well internally i'm pinging ips, but i also tried google.com
dns is not working. looks like that particular computer is not connected to the network
no, i said i couldn't even ping ips
there is no reason why you can't ping local network IPs unless that particular computer is not connected to the network, or the routing table is messed up
kk, so ifdown eth0; ifup eth0 then?
try it
ifup eth0 is taking forever
check your network connections
it looks like you can't even renew your IP. are you using dhcp?
kk
no, requesting a specific ip.  but this was working for the past couple months
gateway down?
this computer is on the same network
so i think that means no
though this one is connected through wireless
wiring might be to blame. switch to dhcp and see if it grabs an IP
np
must be a faulty switch
